analyzed: ayakūṭa jātaka  sabba āyasam kūṭam atippamāṇa

translated: “You who stand in the sky, with a peak of all iron,
you are appointed to protect me, are you not?
Or do you intend to kill me?”
“I am a messenger of the king of the rākṣasas,
I have been sent to kill you;
But the king of the gods, Indra, protects you,

original: Tenuttamaṅgaṁ na te phālayāmi”.🔽“Sace ca maṁ rakkhati devarājā,
analyzed: tena uttamaṅgam na te phālayāmi  sace ca mama rakkhati devarājā
translated: so I will not break your head.”
“If the king of the gods, Maghavā, the lord of Sujā, protects me,
then let all the piśācas wail,
the rākṣasīs will not harm my people.
The piśācas are not able to fight,
The Birth Story of Ayakūṭa, the seventh.
